paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the KCNH2 gene, specifically L646E and F557L, and their implications in channel function and disease.

functional_data.summary: The L646E mutation eliminated activity of PD, indicating steric interference with ligand binding.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was studied in the context of its effects on hERG1 channel function.
key_quotes: A point mutation in S6 (L646E) eliminated activity of PD, and molecular modeling predicted this was caused by steric interference with ligand binding.

functional_data.summary: The F557L mutation was introduced in the context of studying hERG1 channel properties.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was part of the study on the effects of various mutations on hERG1 channel function.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding KCNH2 variants were extracted from the main text.
